intro: Linanthus pungens subsp. pungens, commonly known as the spiked flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Linanthus pungens subsp. pungens is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is an important species for pollinators in its native habitat.
